The idiot watched a movie and let it inform his policy decisions... What a fucking clown.  But let's also not pretend like he isn't trying to follow in Bukele's footsteps here. Even though this type of project would be extremely costly, impractical, inhumane, and would amount to a massive logistical nightmare, this is just another attempt from Trump to appeal to his seething and mindless followers with more "law and order," "tough on crime" dog whistling.  Alcatraz was abandoned for a reason. It's literally a ruin at this point. They've actually had to reinforce areas of the prison to prevent concrete from falling on the heads of tourists.  Its buildings are missing roofs and entire walls, there's no sewage system or running water, and the government pronounced it a crumbling "relic" over 60 years ago when they closed it down.  Alcatraz was also deemed insolvent, costly and "insufficient" to house prisoners. Rebuilding and maintaining it is just impractical from a mere economic perspective.  But now Trump wants to restore this relic because he watched a movie recently and he's more interested in rallying his base into a frenzy over more promises of "crime and punishment" and imprisoning "undesirables."  In all likelihood, Trump won't be able to follow through on yet another absurd proposal, but that hasn't stopped his supporters from demanding that Trump's political opponents be the first to grace its cells.  I bet Trump's also thinking that he can use Alcatraz as a Bukele-like "terrorist containment center" where he can incarcerate so-called migrant "gang members" and "criminals," as well as foreign students, protestors, journalists and political dissidents with little to no due process.
